answers.answer: You may need a 2 or 3  month rest from the contact lenses - before you can even get an accurate glasses prescription - so the glasses prescription you are wearing now may not be quite right.  I would make sure you see an ophthalmologist at least once to make  sure there is no abnormalities of the eye - especially the lens, retina, cornea that could account for the vison problems.  At some point you might even have to wear a contact lens and glasses prescription over that for best possible vision.  Honestly, your problems are not terribly unusual for someone with your numbers.MJK MD

You are not alone.  My prescription is about the same as yours and I have an astigmatism, too.  I was just at the opthamologist a few months ago and got new contacts and glasses.  Everything was fine for a couple of months, now I have to wear reading glasses.  I couldn't even read the aisle signs at WalMart to see where I was going.  And forget about reading labels...Plus I am having to get my daughter to read things for me, even though I have the reading glasses.  I wonder if my diabetes or blood pressure have anything to do with it...
